page.title: 10STAYLEY HALL (CONT.)
page.content: or shingles.All the materials were obtained locally,timber from the valley's forest,gritstone was quarried locally and sandstone from Dukinfield.The five stone outbuildings were rebuilt in the 18th century when some original wattle and daub was replaced by locally made bricks.A cheese press is carved 1719.The hall is part of{Stayley Hall Farm}and is owned by the Stamford Estates who own most of the surrounding land.The hall was lived in till 1912 when the new farmhouse was built.It is now derelict.Much of the groundfloor has been used as a cattle shed.When its future was reviewed in 1975 there seemed to be nobody willing to preserve the building."It is damp and rotten.Slates are falling.Timber is rotting.Bushes are sprouting,living birds are nesting-people are long gone
